enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked
The corresponding interrupt source is not masked
The corresponding interrupt source is masked
The corresponding interrupt source is not masked
The corresponding interrupt source is masked
The corresponding interrupt source is not masked
The corresponding interrupt source is masked
The corresponding interrupt source is not masked
The corresponding interrupt source is masked
The corresponding interrupt source is not masked
Reception immediately stops and transmission stops after a bad CRC is appended to any currently transmitted frame
MAC is enabled, and reception and transmission are possible
Magic detection logic disabled
The MAC core detects magic packets and asserts EIR[WAKEUP] when a frame is detected
Normal operating mode
Sleep mode
Legacy FEC buffer descriptors and functions enabled
Enhanced frame time-stamping functions enabled
MAC continues operation in debug mode
MAC enters hardware freeze mode when the processor is in debug mode
The buffer descriptor bytes are not swapped to support big-endian devices
The buffer descriptor bytes are swapped to support little-endian devices
Write frame operation, but not MII compliant
Write frame operation for a valid MII management frame
Read frame operation for a valid MII management frame
Read frame operation, but not MII compliant
Preamble enabled
Preamble (32 ones) is not prepended to the MII management frame
1 internal module clock cycle
2 internal module clock cycles
3 internal module clock cycles
8 internal module clock cycles
Loopback disabled
Transmitted frames are looped back internal to the device and transmit MII output signals are not asserted. DRT must be cleared
Receive path operates independently of transmit (use for full duplex or to monitor transmit activity in half duplex mode)
Disable reception of frames while transmitting (normally used for half duplex mode)
MII or RMII mode, as indicated by the RMII_MODE bit

field.name: PROM
field.description: Promiscuous mode. All frames are accepted regardless of address matching

enumeratedValue.description: Disabled
Enabled
MAC configured for MII mode
MAC configured for RMII operation
100 Mbps operation
10 Mbps operation

field.name: PADEN
field.description: Enable Frame Padding Remove On Receive

enumeratedValue.description: No padding is removed on receive by the MAC
Padding is removed from received frames
Pause frames are terminated and discarded in the MAC
Pause frames are forwarded to the user application
The CRC field of received frames is transmitted to the user application
The CRC field is stripped from the frame
MAC control frames with any opcode other than 0x0001 (pause frame) are accepted and forwarded to the client interface
MAC control frames with any opcode other than 0x0001 (pause frame) are silently discarded
The payload length check is disabled
The core checks the frame's payload length with the frame length/type field. Errors are indicated in the EIR[PLC] field
No PAUSE frame transmitted
The MAC stops transmission of data frames after the current transmission is complete

field.name: ADDSEL
field.description: Source MAC Address Select On Transmit

enumeratedValue.description: Node MAC address programmed on PADDR1/2
The source MAC address is not modified by the MAC
The MAC overwrites the source MAC address with the programmed MAC address according to ADDSEL

field.name: CRCFWD
field.description: Forward Frame From Application With CRC

enumeratedValue.description: TxBD[TC] controls whether the frame has a CRC from the application
The transmitter does not append any CRC to transmitted frames, as it is expecting a frame with CRC from the application
64 bytes written
64 bytes written
128 bytes written
192 bytes written
4032 bytes written
Disabled, the transmission start threshold is programmed in TFWR
Enabled

register.name: TDSR
register.description: Transmit Buffer Descriptor Ring Start Register

field.name: RX_SECTION_FULL
field.description: Value Of Receive FIFO Section Full Threshold

field.name: RX_SECTION_EMPTY
field.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Section Empty Threshold

field.name: RX_ALMOST_EMPTY
field.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Almost Empty Threshold

field.name: RX_ALMOST_FULL
field.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Almost Full Threshold

field.name: TX_SECTION_EMPTY
field.description: Value Of The Transmit FIFO Section Empty Threshold

field.name: TX_ALMOST_EMPTY
field.description: Value Of Transmit FIFO Almost Empty Threshold

field.name: TX_ALMOST_FULL
field.description: Value Of The Transmit FIFO Almost Full Threshold

enumeratedValue.description: Disabled

Indicates to the transmit data FIFO, that the written frames contain two additional octets before the frame data. This means the actual frame starts at bit 16 of the first word written into the FIFO. This function allows putting the frame payload on a 32-bit boundary in memory, as the 14-byte Ethernet header is extended to a 16-byte header
Checksum is not inserted
If an IP frame is transmitted, the checksum is inserted automatically. The IP header checksum field must be cleared. If a non-IP frame is transmitted the frame is not modified
Checksum not inserted
If an IP frame with a known protocol is transmitted, the checksum is inserted automatically into the frame. The checksum field must be cleared. The other frames are not modified

field.name: PADREM
field.description: Enable Padding Removal For Short IP Frames

enumeratedValue.description: Padding not removed
Any bytes following the IP payload section of the frame are removed from the frame

field.name: IPDIS
field.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With Wrong IPv4 Header Checksum

enumeratedValue.description: Frames with wrong IPv4 header checksum are not discarded

If an IPv4 frame is received with a mismatching header checksum, the frame is discarded. IPv6 has no header checksum and is not affected by this setting. Discarding is only available when the RX FIFO operates in store and forward mode (RSFL cleared)

field.name: PRODIS
field.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With Wrong Protocol Checksum

enumeratedValue.description: Frames with wrong checksum are not discarded

If a TCP/IP, UDP/IP, or ICMP/IP frame is received that has a wrong TCP, UDP, or ICMP checksum, the frame is discarded. Discarding is only available when the RX FIFO operates in store and forward mode (RSFL cleared)

field.name: LINEDIS
field.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With MAC Layer Errors

enumeratedValue.description: Frames with errors are not discarded
Any frame received with a CRC, length, or PHY error is automatically discarded and not forwarded to the user application interface
Disabled
Instructs the MAC to write two additional bytes in front of each frame received into the RX FIFO

register.name: RMON_T_DROP
register.description: Count of frames not counted correctly (RMON_T_DROP). NOTE: Counter not implemented (read 0 always) as not applicable

register.name: RMON_T_CRC_ALIGN
register.description: RMON Tx Packets w CRC/Align error (RMON_T_CRC_ALIGN)

register.name: RMON_T_UNDERSIZE
register.description: RMON Tx Packets < 64 bytes, good CRC (RMON_T_UNDERSIZE)

register.name: RMON_T_OVERSIZE
register.description: RMON Tx Packets > MAX_FL bytes, good CRC (RMON_T_OVERSIZE)

register.name: RMON_T_FRAG
register.description: RMON Tx Packets < 64 bytes, bad CRC (RMON_T_FRAG)

register.name: RMON_T_JAB
register.description: RMON Tx Packets > MAX_FL bytes, bad CRC (RMON_T_JAB)

register.name: IEEE_T_DROP
register.description: Count of frames not counted correctly (IEEE_T_DROP). NOTE: Counter not implemented (read 0 always) as not applicable

register.name: IEEE_T_MACERR
register.description: Frames Transmitted with Tx FIFO Underrun (IEEE_T_MACERR)

register.name: IEEE_T_CSERR
register.description: Frames Transmitted with Carrier Sense Error (IEEE_T_CSERR)

register.name: IEEE_T_SQE
register.description: Frames Transmitted with SQE Error (IEEE_T_SQE). NOTE: Counter not implemented (read 0 always) as no SQE information is available

register.name: IEEE_T_OCTETS_OK
register.description: Octet count for Frames Transmitted w/o Error (IEEE_T_OCTETS_OK). NOTE: Counts total octets (includes header and FCS fields)

register.name: RMON_R_CRC_ALIGN
register.description: RMON Rx Packets w CRC/Align error (RMON_R_CRC_ALIGN)

register.name: RMON_R_UNDERSIZE
register.description: RMON Rx Packets < 64 bytes, good CRC (RMON_R_UNDERSIZE)

register.name: RMON_R_OVERSIZE
register.description: RMON Rx Packets > MAX_FL bytes, good CRC (RMON_R_OVERSIZE)

register.name: RMON_R_FRAG
register.description: RMON Rx Packets < 64 bytes, bad CRC (RMON_R_FRAG)

register.name: RMON_R_JAB
register.description: RMON Rx Packets > MAX_FL bytes, bad CRC (RMON_R_JAB)

register.name: IEEE_R_DROP
register.description: Count of frames not counted correctly (IEEE_R_DROP). NOTE: Counter increments if a frame with valid/missing SFD character is detected and has been dropped. None of the other counters increments if this counter increments

register.name: IEEE_R_OCTETS_OK
register.description: Octet count for Frames Rcvd w/o Error (IEEE_R_OCTETS_OK). Counts total octets (includes header and FCS fields)

enumeratedValue.description: The timer stops at the current value
The timer starts incrementing
Disable

The timer can be reset to zero when the given offset time is reached (offset event). The field is cleared when the offset event is reached, so no further event occurs until the field is set again. The timer offset value must be set before setting this field
The timer is not affected and no action occurs (besides clearing OFFEN) when the offset is reached
If OFFEN is set, the timer resets to zero when the offset setting is reached. The offset event does not cause a timer interrupt
Disable

A period event interrupt can be generated (EIR[TS_TIMER]) and the event signal output is asserted when the timer wraps around according to the periodic setting ATPER. The timer period value must be set before setting this bit. Not all devices contain the event signal output. See the chip configuration details
Disable
Enable
No effect
The current time is captured and can be read from the ATVR register
The timer is active and all configuration fields in this register are relevant

The internal timer is disabled and the externally provided timer value is used. All other fields, except CAPTURE, in this register have no effect. CAPTURE can still be used to capture the current timer value

field.name: INC
field.description: Clock Period Of The Timestamping Clock (ts_clk) In Nanoseconds

field.name: TF0
field.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 0

enumeratedValue.description: Timer Flag for Channel 0 is clear
Timer Flag for Channel 0 is set

field.name: TF1
field.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 1

enumeratedValue.description: Timer Flag for Channel 1 is clear
Timer Flag for Channel 1 is set

field.name: TF2
field.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 2

enumeratedValue.description: Timer Flag for Channel 2 is clear
Timer Flag for Channel 2 is set

field.name: TF3
field.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 3

enumeratedValue.description: Timer Flag for Channel 3 is clear
Timer Flag for Channel 3 is set
DMA request is disabled
DMA request is enabled
Timer Channel is disabled
Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on rising edge
Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on falling edge
Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on both edges
Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - software only
Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - toggle output on compare
Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare
Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare
Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare, set output on overflow

enumeratedValue.name: 10x1
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare, clear output on overflow
Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output low on compare for one 1588 clock cycle
Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output high on compare for one 1588 clock cycle
Interrupt is disabled
Interrupt is enabled
Input Capture or Output Compare has not occurred
Input Capture or Output Compare has occurred
